item.title: About Dinesh
item.description:
Namaskar/Greetings Fellow’s:

I was born and raised in Nepal, a country known for Himalaya and the birthplace of Buddha. I completed my bachelor’s degree in Agriculture science with minor in plant breeding.

I then joined West Virginia State University (WVSU) for my MS in Biotechnology. At WVSU, I worked on improving vintage tomato varieties using Marker assisted selection and background selection. I also worked on incompatibility issues while crossing heirlooms with the commercial variety.

Grants, Awards, Scholarships, and Fellowships:

  • Travel Grant from National Association of Plant Breeders (NAPB) (USD 1,000) in 2025
  • Travel Grant for Conference on Water, Climate, and Food Security, Texas (USD 3,000) in 2023
  • National Association of Plant Breeders (NAPB) Borlaug Scholar in 2022
  • Travel Grant NAPB Annual Meeting (USD 2,000) in 2022
  • Book scholarship, WVSU (USD 200) in Spring of 2022
  • Dr. Ida Kramer Scholarship, WVSU (USD 700) in Spring of 2022
  • Golden Jubilee Scholarship from the Government of India (USD 1,000) in 2015-2016
  • B.Sc. Academic Merit Scholarship, Tribhuvan University, Nepal (USD 5,000) in 2015-2019
  • Mahatma Gandhi Scholarship from the Government of India (USD 500) in 2013

PUBLICATIONS, ABSTRACTS AND POSTER PRESENTATIONS

PhD (Robbins Lab)

  • Ghimire, D., Coulibaly, I., De Vos, D., Baert, J., and Robbins, K.R. 2025. UAV based Remote Sensing for Spatial Modeling and Sparse Phenotyping in Crop Fields. Poster (#109) Presented at NAPB Annual Meeting, Kona, Hawaii. Abstract. Page 114. https://napbannualmeeting.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/NAPB_2025_Booklet_Digital_VF2.pdf

  • Ghimire, D., Bacher, H., Mosher, S., Twohey III, R.J., Studer, A.J., Robbins, K.R., and Gore, M.A. 2024. Enhancing Predictive Accuracy of Key Agronomic Traits Using a Hierarchical Bayesian Approach Integrating Omics Data. Poster Presented at the CROPPS Annual Meeting, Tucson, Arizona.
